1.title: The Court Jester
1.plot: Andrew Klavan provides the sensitive and the easily offended with a trigger warning for the debut of his podcast, in which he discusses the politics of the Emmy awards ceremony.

366.title: Nazi Scum, Commie Scum, Media Scum
366.plot: The leftists battle statues. Nazis and white supremacists try to go mainstream. The Rev. Jesse Lee Peterson is thrown out of his gym.

367.title: Is the Trump Presidency Over?
367.plot: The Boston protest is confusing but peaceful. Steve Bannon is out of the Trump White House. Candace Owens refuses to panic. Jerry Lewis dies at 91. Michael Knowles talks comedy. Suicide among the young is epidemic.

368.title: What Trump Really Said About Afghanistan
368.plot: Klavan understands Trump re Afghanistan differently from everyone else. Dinesh D'Souza talks about his new book, "The Big Lie". Sierra Marlee hates nice guys.

369.title: CNN Crushed by Godzilla Trump
369.plot: Klavan explains white privilege. Donald Trump makes like a Japanese monster.

370.title: The Bill of Rights Under Attack
370.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

371.title: Is MAGA Over?
371.plot: Time is running out to panic and blame everything on Trump. Andrew talks about a divided USA. Michael Knowles talks about violence in Berkeley.

372.title: Trump Outsmarts the Press
372.plot: The media searches for an anti-Trump angle to the Hurricane Harvey story. Steven Crowder guests.

373.title: Hurricane of Lies
373.plot: Michael has a few kind words to say about the media before ripping them up and down.

374.title: Is Harvey a Turning Point?
374.plot: Politico and Charlie Hebdo sneer at Texans. Dianne Feinstein hopes Donald Trump will be a good president. Andrew recommends Boethius.

375.title: Cleaning Up After Hurricane Obama
375.plot: The media's new narrative is "Trump is mean". On Knucklehead Row, David Brooks draws strange conclusions from Hurricane Harvey. Kim Jong-un sets off a bomb. Taylor Swift grows ever darker.

376.title: Dreamers, Lies, Hypocrisy and also Lies
376.plot: Klavan discusses DACA, porn addiction, Ian Fleming, time traveling to WWI, and more. Sebastian Gorka guests, and Michael J. Knowles makes an appearance in piggyback Trump pants.

377.title: Trump Goes Left
377.plot: Bernie Sanders writes a children's book. Donald Trump shifts leftward. Victor Davis Hanson talks Trump. Klavan catches up on recent movies. Shelley's "Ozymandias" earns his admiration.

378.title: Freedom's Greatest Enemy
378.plot: Football players dishonor the flag. Andrew finds Steve Bannon's "60 Minutes" interview fascinating. Michael Knowles guests to talk about the culture, including Jennifer Lawrence, Stephen Colbert, and more.

379.title: Drinking Clinton's Tears
379.plot: Hillary Clinton fulfills the stereotypes about women. The media decides Trump's DACA decision is cruel. Paul Beston talks about his new book, "The Boxing Kings: When American Heavyweights Ruled the Ring".

380.title: Is Trump Betraying His Base
380.plot: Donald Trump's base sticks with him. Jeff Sessions says he won't prosecute Lois Lerner. Sarah Huckabee Sanders defends Trump re the firing of James Comey. Klavan expresses his love of London, Rome, Edinburgh, and the Alps.

381.title: Amnesty Don???
381.plot: Donald Trump makes a deal on DACA, but he insists the wall is still getting built. Hillary Clinton demonstrates alternate-nostril yoga breathing. The author Kurt Schlichter guests.

382.title: St. Louis Stupid, Hollywood Hateful
382.plot: Demonstrators in St. Louis protest a 2011 police shooting. Nikki Haley is done with North Korea. Michael Knowles guests to talk about the Emmys.

383.title: The Resistance Is Failing
383.plot: Donald Trump gives an explosive speech to the UN. The DREAMers shout down Rep. Nancy Pelosi. Sex-bots have the potential to kill. Klavan interviews the professor of philosophy Edward Feser.

384.title: TV to GOP: We Hate You!
384.plot: The media react hysterically to Donald Trump's UN speech. Politics trump comedy for late-night comedians like Jimmy Kimmel. Klavan has a nice thing to say about Black Lives Matter.

385.title: The Jimmy Kimmel Party
385.plot: Klavan interviews the forensic psychologist Dr. Helen Smith about the trend for teenagers to refrain from drinking and sex. Klavan lists some great directors who started out making small noir crime films.

386.title: NFL - Numbskull Freaking Losers
386.plot: Anthony Weiner goes to prison. Donald Trump slams the NFL. Michael J. Knowles guests, and talks about whether the pope is Catholic. Free Speech Week in Berkeley is canceled.

387.title: Has the Right Surrendered the Culture?
387.plot: The conservative Hollywood writer, Christian Toto guests; he and Klavan discuss boycotting films vs. making more conservative ones.

388.title: Too Much Winning
388.plot: Donald Trump is winning the culture war, says Klavan. The media says Puerto Rico is Donald Trump's Katrina. Klavan gives his take on the Bible.

389.title: The Hefner Legacy
389.plot: Hugh Hefner dies at 91. Donald Trump pushes tax reform. Women can drive in Saudi Arabia. The New York Times lauds communism. Twitter doubles the number of characters allowed per tweet. Candice Owens guests and talks about her blog "RedPillBlack". Klavan shows clips of good movies for women: "Now Voyager" (1942), "Mildred Pierce" (1945) and "Bringing Up Baby" (1938).

390.title: The People vs the News
390.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

391.title: Is Leftism a Mental Disorder?
391.plot: Emotions trump facts for leftists, says Klavan, and that's a prescription for madness.

392.title: OK Then, Let's Talk Guns
392.plot: Klavan demonstrates that his emotions makes him an expert on any topic, including gun control and health care. Mailbag topics include: the necessity of making arguments in secular terms; emotions vs. sensations; Raymond Chandler; and more.

393.title: American Heroes vs Universal Evil
393.plot: Stories of heroism emerge in the wake of the Las Vegas shooting. Klavan interviews the syndicated columnist, Mona Charen. New indie horror films - such as "It Follows" (2014), "Get Out" (2017) and "It Comes at Night" (2017) - address social issues.

394.title: A Cultural Earthquake
394.plot: Klavan discusses the Harvey Weinstein scandal, Mike Pence at a football game, Columbus Day, and more.

395.title: Real Housewives of the Swamp
395.plot: Ivana Trump plugs her new book. Donald Trump fights with Senator Bob Corker. More awful stories come out about the movie producer, Harvey Weinstein. A feminist marries herself.

396.title: One Hollywood Hero
396.plot: Actresses come forward to condemn Harvey Weinstein, many of them reporting on their own abuse at his hands. Mailbag topics include: separating the artist from art, the morality of revenge, and more.

397.title: Trump, Harvey and Free Speech?
397.plot: Steven Crowder guests; he discusses Hollywood hypocrisy, left-wing comedy, and more. Klavan recommends the Robert Altman's movie, "The Long Goodbye" (1973).

398.title: Trump's Best Worst Week Ever
398.plot: "Morning Joe" obsesses over the 25th amendment. A "Rick and Morty" fan goes nuts in a McDonald's. Michael Knowles guests; he discusses his undercover adventures at NBC.

399.title: Donald in Media Wonderland
399.plot: Andrew Klavan talks with the psychologist, Dr. Jean Twenge. NBC's "Today" show sells socialism with a report on Denmark. Donald Trump has a 40-minute press conference.

400.title: Blaming Harvey's Victims
400.plot: Klavan hates feminism and the Twitter hashtag, #MeToo, almost as much as he hates those who abuse power.

401.title: NY Times Says Trump Is Not Hitler!
401.plot: The New York Times concedes that Donald Trump is not Hitler - but there's a "but". Klavan talks with Lee Smith of the Weekly Standard about what started the Trump/Russia narrative.

402.title: The Real Benghazi
402.plot: As Rep. Frederica Wilson claims the Niger situation is Donald Trump's Benghazi, Klavan reminds us what the real Benghazi was.

403.title: Is O'Reilly Different from Weinstein?
403.plot: TV writer Rob Long talks about his new book "Bigly: Donald Trump in Verse". Bill O'Reilly defends himself on Glenn Beck.

404.title: From Russia to Democrats with Love
404.plot: Phil Robertson of "Duck Dynasty" guests and talks about his new show, "In the Woods with Phil" on CRTV. Mailbag topics include: professional jealousy; snooping through the phone of a fiance; and more.

405.title: Hip Hip Hypocrisy!
405.plot: Paul Kengor guests, and talks about his book, "The Politically Incorrect Guide to Communism: The Killingest Idea Ever".

406.title: Accused!
406.plot: Robert Mueller indicts Paul Manafort. Anthony Rapp accuses Kevin Spacey. Michael Knowles guests and discusses his podcast with Klavan, Hollywood costumes, and more.

407.title: Halloween Terror: Hillary as President!
407.plot: Donald Trump meets with the children of the press. Tony Podesta resigns from the Podesta Group. John Podesta's lawyer, Geoff Garinther, threatens Tucker Carlson.

408.title: Don't Mention the War with Islamism!!!
408.plot: Jake Tapper gets angry at Drew. Mailbag topics include: the usefulness of the Left; a man feeling guilty over a friend's suicide; famous people women can look to as role models; and more.

409.title: Islamist Attacks, Dems Blame Trump
409.plot: Drew explains the complicated Russian conspiracy in which Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama prove to be the villains and Donald Trump the would-have-been patsy.

410.title: The Left in Flames
410.plot: The Left promotes gun control after the Texas church mass-shooting, while attacking "thoughts and prayers". Michael Knowles guests and talks about visiting his alma mater, Yale.

411.title: The Left Against God
411.plot: The Left attacks "thoughts and prayers". Christina Hoff Sommers guests; she and Drew discuss: "fainting-couch" feminism, Harvey Weinstein, being a gentleman, and more.

412.title: Democrats Don't Lose; Democrats Go Wild!
412.plot: Drew broadcasts from a cold New York hotel room. Mailbag topics include: eating Michael Knowles, the importance of physical attraction, how to get out of the Ecclesiastes mindset, getting an Andrew Klavan tattoo, and more.

413.title: The Weirdness of the Left
413.plot: The media reports that the various state elections were a referendum on Donald Trump; the statistician Henry Olsen disagrees. Drew interviews Montse Alvarado, executive director of the Becket Fund for Religious Liberty.

414.title: Me and Roy
414.plot: Andrew Klavan has something personal to say about the Roy Moore scandal. In a New York Times op-ed, Ekow N. Yankah asks, "Can My Children Be Friends With White People?"

415.title: Clintons Under the Bus
415.plot: The Democrats throw Bill and Hillary under the bus. A fifth accuser comes out against Roy Moore. Drew welcomes his guest, the documentary filmmaker Cassie Jaye.

416.title: Investigate Everyone!
416.plot: Investigations and investigations of investigations continue in Washington D.C. Roy Moore loses Sean Hannity as an ally.

417.title: Sleaze-Bob No Pants
417.plot: The media continues to ignore the Bob Menendez trial, while spending lots of air time on Roy Moore. Drew recommends "Compulsion" (1959), "Rope" (1948) and "Murder by the Numbers" (2002). Sebastian Gorka guests.

418.title: What Manson Meant to Us
418.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

419.title: Sex, Lies and Barack Obama
419.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

420.title: A Year to Be Thankful For
420.plot: Drew discusses the things he is grateful for, including the success of his podcast "Another Kingdom", Barack Obama's absence from the White House, and more.

421.title: Welcome to Moral Chaos
421.plot: Andrew Klavan bemoans the bottom falling out of our moral sense. Michael Knowles guests to talk about forgotten holidays.

422.title: Everybody Stinks Except Melania
422.plot: Donald Trump is rude at a ceremony honoring Navajo code-talkers. James O'Keefe's sting operation against the Washington Post falls flat. Melania wins Drew's admiration.

423.title: Trump Trolls Everybody!
423.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

424.title: Awful People Doing Good Things
424.plot: Donald Trump retweets Britain First. NBC claims they had no idea Matt Lauer was assaulting women. Ken Stern guests to talk about his book, "Republican Like Me: How I Left the Liberal Bubble and Learned to Love the Right".

425.title: Trump's Right: His Opponents Are in Tatters
425.plot: The tentacle porn guy says that Donald Trump's tax plan killed America. Robert Mueller indicts Michael Flynn for lying to the FBI. Michael Knowles guests to talk about Christmas.

426.title: The Real FBI Story
426.plot: Robert Mueller is embarrassed by Peter Strzok. Drew interviews Lauren Southern, author of "Barbarians: How Baby Boomers, Immigrants, and Islam Screwed My Generation".

427.title: #Resistance Is Futile
427.plot: Fires rage in California. Trump declares that Jerusalem the capital of Israel. Six female senators call on Al Franken to resign. Trump's enemies continue their self-immolation.

428.title: Stuart Smalley and the Homo-Nazis
428.plot: Al Franken resigns from the senate, but the Right is skeptical of the Left's newfound sexual morality. Drew talks with the former assistant U.S. attorney and NRO writer, Andrew C. McCarthy.

429.title: All the News Is One Big Scam
429.plot: Drew addresses the "great moral question of our time". Michael Knowles guests to discuss the Annunciation.

430.title: Swamp Monsters Attack Trump in Force
430.plot: Old accusers resurface. Everyday Feminism proffers ten questions to ask a first date. Drew and his guest Jonah Goldberg talk about, and disagree about, Donald Trump.

431.title: Who's To Blame for the Alabama Disaster
431.plot: Roy Moore loses the U.S. Senate seat to Doug Jones, and Drew wonders whether Republicans will learn from it.

432.title: Four Reasons We Get the Future Wrong
432.plot: Santa Claus, in animated form, guests. Drew dresses down never-Trumpers. Hollywood reporter Christian Toto guests to talk about sex scandals, upcoming movies, and more.

433.title: A Yuge Year for Patriots
433.plot: Donald Trump may not be moral himself, but he is creating a more moral government, argues Drew. Michael Knowles guests to talk about the Nativity.

434.title: The Great Conservative Mistake
434.plot: Drew interviews Stephen Willeford, the man who stopped the Texas church shooting.

435.title: Taxes Cut, World Ends
435.plot: In the wake of Trump's tax plan passing, Drew reviews everything the media has gotten wrong during the past year.

436.title: Episode #1.436
436.plot: Santa Claus returns as guest for the last show of the year. Dwight Lindsey, the Victorian novel professor at Hillsdale College guests to talk about Charles Dickens' "A Christmas Carol".

437.title: Bringing Down the Leftist Madhouse

439.title: Steve Bannon Confirms Russia Collusion? Or Is It All Fake News?
439.plot: Drew tears apart Michael Wolff's new book on the Trump administration. John Nolte from Breitbart guests.

440.title: Hollywood and the News Media Attack Themselves
440.plot:
Know what this is about?

441.title: Who Killed Reality
441.plot: James Damore sues Google. David Brooks sees the light. Mollie Hemingway of The Federalist guests to talk about the Golden Globes, the Left's latest narrative on Donald Trump, and more.

442.title: Is Trump Betraying Trump?
442.plot: Breitbart kicks out Steve Bannon. Sebastian Gorka guests to talk about no-go zones in Sweden.

443.title: How to Be a Warrior for Truth

444.title: Trump's No Racist; Leftism is Racism

445.title: Feminists vs. Women
445.plot: An anonymous woman's accusations against Aziz Ansari lead to the crumbling of the #metoo movement. Stand-up comedian Owen Benjamin guests.

446.title: Journalists Fail Sanity Test
446.plot: The press goes crazy when Ronny Jackson, Physician to the President, says Trump is not crazy. Mailbag topics include Drew's favorite Scotch, praying out loud, video games as an art form, and more.

447.title: Democrats Play Women
447.plot: Drew tells the story of evolution via Genesis and Adam and Eve. James O'Keefe guests to talk about his new book, "American Pravda: My Fight for Truth in the Era of Fake News".

448.title: Weep for Illegals and Hand Over Your Country
448.plot: The brief government shutdown ends. The Women's March and the March for Life happen simultaneously. Drew talks with Michael Knowles about the finale of their podcast, "Another Kingdom", Catholic marriage class, and more.

449.title: Deep Silence on Deep State Abuses
449.plot:
Know what this is about?

450.title: When We, the People Have No Voice
450.plot: Drew explains why he doesn't give a damn about the Oscars anymore.

451.title: Trump Says He'll Talk; Dems Want More Silence
451.plot: Drew explains his discussion of Satan. Trump says he's glad to talk to Robert Mueller. Henry Olsen guests to discuss the midterms.

452.title: Soros and his Cronies Rave
452.plot: The New York Times reports that Trump might have done something, but didn't. Drew talks about globalism, imperialism, the marketplace of ideas, and more. Michael Knowles guests to talk about the Grammys.

453.title: The Trouble at the FBI Is the Media's Fault

456.title: The Real Scandal Within the Scandal
456.plot: The press scandalously downplays the FISA memo. Michael Knowles guests to discuss the Super Bowl ads.

457.title: Trump's Hope, Dem's Apocalypse
457.plot: Donald Trump seems to be having a good time, while Democrats are all doom-and-gloom. Drew interviews Stephen Eide from the Manhattan Institute about homelessness.

458.title: The Battle for Your Brain
458.plot: Drew, broadcasting from Washington D.C., answers the mailbag and discusses Trump's principles or lack thereof, the latest in the FBI texting scandal, and more.

459.title: The Great Trump Hysteria
459.plot: Drew talks about his experience at the National Prayer Breakfast.

460.title: Media Hearts North Korea
460.plot: The media fawns over Kim Jong-Un's sister; Satan shows up to explain why. Michael Knowles guests to talk about the Olympics.

461.title: Obama Spied, Hillary Lied
461.plot: Drew asks us whether we want to discuss the budget or porn and decides to talk about both. Hannah Scherlacher, from Campus Reform, guests.

462.title: How Much Do They Hate God & Country?
462.plot: The Left hates America and Jesus, argues Drew. Mailbag topics include: asking Jesus a question; wives who don't want sex after 50; Christian rituals; free will; and more.

463.title: What Can We Learn from the Florida Shootings
463.plot: Drew discusses the Florida high school shooting. Douglas Murray talks about his new book, "The Strange Death of Europe: Immigration, Identity, Islam".

464.title: The Great Non-Crisis of 2018
464.plot: The media bemoans a crisis that doesn't exist. Michael Knowles guests to talk about Black Panther (2018).
